title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: R. M. Manly to N. C. Brackett, January 7, 1867
summary: Manly forwards to Brackett General Brown's demand for more specific accusations against Frederick Tukey in Staunton, if any are to be made. Manly chastizes Brackett, calling him an outsider, and pointing out that the Bureau has been acquainted with the parties involved much longer than Brackett himself has.
